text: <!channel> I just spoke with Shawn and there are some concerns about the amount of space in the Setting section given the padding and font size, especially when viewed on an iPhone 5. We’re losing a lot of space by using the custom 18pt padding verse the IOS default of 14pt, but that is probably not something we want to change. Most likely the font size will need to be tweaked, which we can discuss further as these issues arise.
looking forward to seeing and discussing that on some samples
Thanks for the heads-up on that Ali
<@U0260V1BX|melissa> pinned their PDF <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/melissa/F236VLLSY/2016_08_18_16_17_home_wireframes_mbc.pdf|2016 08 18 16 17 Home_Wireframes_MBC.pdf> to this channel.

<@U026PLK4S>: do we have an approved visual direction for the pre-login screens? wondering what the status of those is, as katrina would like me to incorporate final designs into the onboarding wireframe doc when they’re available.
hey there. <@U02AUNA0P> sent our latest and greatest to scott on friday which were “approved” by scott over the weekend.
awesome. <@U02AUNA0P> can you please post those comps to Comp Share?
yeah, will do so right now

<@U0260V1BX> They are now in the Onboarding Comp Folder
<https://www.dropbox.com/sh/2gu2hq6wkn9f4dd/AAD-dUk73pCUXsDD059GXYjya?dl=0>
Question for someone… are we allowing the app to go into landscape?

ok cool. We’re not going to turn off landscape for a while because it allows us to do some tests that would be difficult without it, but it’s good to know that we don’t have to worry about layouts etc

heyo, in vetting motion concepts with Dev, there are a couple areas where we need to scale back a bit for launch and need to find creative solutions to do this. one of the areas being the segmented control on Dx enrollment. Melodee had landed on a solution that was perhaps simple in concept but farther away from “least difficult to implement” from what i’ve understood. 

i’ve landed on this: <https://www.dropbox.com/s/5nuzphy9tejnb7x/160822_SegmentedControl_Header_01.mov?dl=0>

dev feels better about it than the other concepts we’ve explored but i wanted to get eyes from the visual team on it
ok, just chatted with Melissa and there’s a bit of rethinking going on UX-wise. not sure if this will still be relevant afterward. stand by!
going to chat with Adrian tomorrow and will circle back
